PIONEER EXPERIENCE: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

No. 2

A NICE C. GRANDFATHER TO THE PERSON

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experience; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so do not worry about them. Answer the questions you can, and try to give details or describe particular events, if they help you to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1900, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Western Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Experience," is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would like to do so, please put a check mark here (______) and one will be sent to you.

Western Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 2, entitled "Pioneer Experience," is still being circulated. If you have already answered this, and would like to do so, please put a check mark here (______) and one will be sent to you.

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Board,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

No. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A word of explanation to the Reader

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire in pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences and memories. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experience; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. If possible, use separate sheets of paper if there is not sufficient space to answer the questions. It's best to give details, or describe particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1941, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

OTHER QUESTIONNAIRES

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Files: What I'd Like Western Canadian Pioneers Know," is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here (X) and one will be sent to you.

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

(K) All questionnaires

(P) Pioneer health conditions

(P) Pioneer social life, sports and recreation

(P) Pioneer housing

(P) Pioneer education and churchwork

(P) Pioneer farming experience

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our province. Please send your completed questionnaires to the Saskatchewan Archives Office, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.
